subject: Re: [junit] Test organization in J++
msgSnippet: ... J++ does have conditional compiler directives... maybe that s a way I can go. -- Chris http://clabs.org
messageBody:
Chris Morris wrote:

>But J++ compiles these in then as well. Obviously, my issue is all IDE
>driven ... I could get around any of these issues externally, but the
>current team is used to J++ IDE stuffs. I'm searching for that "aha!"
>nugget that may be lurking in the IDE -- I guess a way for the IDE to
>allow easy browsing of the test classes but telling it to not compile
>them with the prod classes.
>
>

J++ does have conditional compiler directives... maybe that's a way I
can go.

--
Chris
http://clabs.org
